section.name: Constructed Types
section.p: Direct assignment of a String value to a component entry is frequently suffivient, however, there are occasions where a complex construction criteria is required. The following example demonstrates the creation of an instance of java.awt.Color using three int values (RGB indexes).

subsection.name: Examples

tr.td: A component that requires a java.awt.Color instance within it's declared context.
Testcase that validates the context color value.

subsection.p: The following fragment form the project build file demonstrates the creation of a constructed value using a series of explicit constructor arguments.
subsection.pre: <component xmlns="metro" type="org.acme.tutorial.ExampleComponent" dest="target/test/example.part" test="true"> <context> <entry key="color"> <value class="int" value="100"/> <value class="int" value="200"/> <value class="int" value="0"/> </entry> </context> </component>
